trans-unit.source: Overview of the Lotus Domino Connector
trans-unit.target: Overview of the Lotus Domino Connector

trans-unit.source: The Lotus Domino Connector enable you to integrate the synchronization service with IBM's Lotus Domino server.
trans-unit.target: The Lotus Domino Connector enable you to integrate the synchronization service with IBM's Lotus Domino server.

trans-unit.source: The Lotus Domino connector leverages the Lotus Notes client to communicate with Lotus Domino Server.
trans-unit.target: The Lotus Domino connector leverages the Lotus Notes client to communicate with Lotus Domino Server.

trans-unit.source: As a consequence of this, a supported Lotus Notes Client must be installed on the synchronization server.
trans-unit.target: As a consequence of this, a supported Lotus Notes Client must be installed on the synchronization server.

trans-unit.source: The communication between the client and the server is implemented through the Lotus Notes .NET Interop (Interop.domino.dll) interface.
trans-unit.target: The communication between the client and the server is implemented through the Lotus Notes .NET Interop (Interop.domino.dll) interface.

trans-unit.source: This interface facilitates the communication between the Microsoft.NET platform and Lotus Notes client and supports access to Lotus Domino documents and views.
trans-unit.target: This interface facilitates the communication between the Microsoft.NET platform and Lotus Notes client and supports access to Lotus Domino documents and views.

trans-unit.source: For delta import it is also possible that the C++ native interface is used (depending on the selected delta import method).
trans-unit.target: For delta import it is also possible that the C++ native interface is used (depending on the selected delta import method).

trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Before you use the Connector, make sure you have the following on the synchronization server in addition to any hotfix mentioned above:
trans-unit.target: Before you use the Connector, make sure you have the following on the synchronization server in addition to any hotfix mentioned above:

trans-unit.source: Microsoft .NET 4.5.2 Framework or later
trans-unit.target: Microsoft .NET 4.5.2 Framework or later

trans-unit.source: The Lotus Notes client must be installed on your synchronization server
trans-unit.target: The Lotus Notes client must be installed on your synchronization server

trans-unit.source: The Lotus Domino Connector requires the default Lotus Domino LDAP schema database (schema.nsf) to be present on the Domino Directory server.
trans-unit.target: The Lotus Domino Connector requires the default Lotus Domino LDAP schema database (schema.nsf) to be present on the Domino Directory server.

trans-unit.source: You need to verify that it is present.
trans-unit.target: You need to verify that it is present.

trans-unit.source: If it is not present you can install it by running or restarting the LDAP service on the Domino server.
trans-unit.target: If it is not present you can install it by running or restarting the LDAP service on the Domino server.

trans-unit.source: When a resource is created a Notes document will be created.
trans-unit.target: When a resource is created a Notes document will be created.

trans-unit.source: Similarly, when a resource is deleted, the Notes document will be deleted.
trans-unit.target: Similarly, when a resource is deleted, the Notes document will be deleted.

trans-unit.source: Ports and protocols
trans-unit.target: Ports and protocols

trans-unit.source: IBM Lotus Notes client and Domino servers communicate using Notes Remote Procedure Call (NRPC) where NRPC should use TCP/IP.
trans-unit.target: IBM Lotus Notes client and Domino servers communicate using Notes Remote Procedure Call (NRPC) where NRPC should use TCP/IP.

trans-unit.source: The default port number is 1352, but can be changed by the Domino administrator.
trans-unit.target: The default port number is 1352, but can be changed by the Domino administrator.

trans-unit.target: Not supported

trans-unit.target: Move mailbox between servers.

trans-unit.source: Client Software Installation and Configuration
trans-unit.target: Client Software Installation and Configuration

trans-unit.source: Lotus Notes must be installed on the server **before** the Connector is installed.
trans-unit.target: Lotus Notes must be installed on the server **before** the Connector is installed.

trans-unit.source: When you install, make sure you do a **Single User Install**.
trans-unit.target: When you install, make sure you do a **Single User Install**.

trans-unit.source: The default **Multi-User Install** will not work.
trans-unit.target: The default **Multi-User Install** will not work.

trans-unit.source: Notes1
trans-unit.target: Notes1

trans-unit.source: On the features page install only the required Lotus Notes features and **Client Single Logon**.
trans-unit.target: On the features page install only the required Lotus Notes features and **Client Single Logon**.

trans-unit.source: Single Logon is required for the connector to be able to logon to the Domino server.
trans-unit.target: Single Logon is required for the connector to be able to logon to the Domino server.

trans-unit.source: Notes2
trans-unit.target: Notes2

trans-unit.source: **Note:** You must start Lotus Notes once with a user that is located on the same server as the account you will use as the connector’s service account.
trans-unit.target: **Note:** You must start Lotus Notes once with a user that is located on the same server as the account you will use as the connector’s service account.

trans-unit.source: Create Connector
trans-unit.target: Create Connector

trans-unit.source: To Create a Lotus Domino connector, in **Synchronization Service** select **Management Agent** and **Create**.
trans-unit.target: To Create a Lotus Domino connector, in **Synchronization Service** select **Management Agent** and **Create**.

trans-unit.source: Select the **Lotus Domino (Microsoft)** Connector.
trans-unit.target: Select the **Lotus Domino (Microsoft)** Connector.

trans-unit.source: CreateConnector
trans-unit.target: CreateConnector

trans-unit.source: If your version of synchronization service offer the ability to set **Architecture**, make sure the connector is set to its default to run in **Process**.
trans-unit.target: If your version of synchronization service offer the ability to set **Architecture**, make sure the connector is set to its default to run in **Process**.

trans-unit.source: Connectivity
trans-unit.target: Connectivity

trans-unit.source: On the Connectivity page, you must specify the Lotus Domino server name and enter the logon credentials.
trans-unit.target: On the Connectivity page, you must specify the Lotus Domino server name and enter the logon credentials.

trans-unit.source: Connectivity
trans-unit.target: Connectivity

trans-unit.source: The Domino Server property supports two formats for the server name:
trans-unit.target: The Domino Server property supports two formats for the server name:

trans-unit.source: ServerName
trans-unit.target: ServerName

trans-unit.source: ServerName/DirectoryName
trans-unit.target: ServerName/DirectoryName

trans-unit.source: The **ServerName/DirectoryName** format is the preferred format for this attribute because it provides faster response when the connector contacts the Domino Server.
trans-unit.target: The **ServerName/DirectoryName** format is the preferred format for this attribute because it provides faster response when the connector contacts the Domino Server.

trans-unit.source: The provided UserID file is stored in the configuration database of the synchronization service.
trans-unit.target: The provided UserID file is stored in the configuration database of the synchronization service.

trans-unit.source: For **Delta Import** you have these options:
trans-unit.target: For **Delta Import** you have these options:

trans-unit.source: **None**.
trans-unit.target: **None**.

trans-unit.source: The Connector will not do any delta imports.
trans-unit.target: The Connector will not do any delta imports.

trans-unit.source: **Add/Update**.
trans-unit.target: **Add/Update**.

trans-unit.source: The Connector will delta import add and update operations.
trans-unit.target: The Connector will delta import add and update operations.

trans-unit.source: For delete a **Full Import** operation is required.
trans-unit.target: For delete a **Full Import** operation is required.

trans-unit.source: This operation is using Notes's .Net interop.
trans-unit.target: This operation is using Notes's .Net interop.

trans-unit.source: **Add/Update/Delete**.
trans-unit.target: **Add/Update/Delete**.

trans-unit.source: The Connector will delta import add, update, and delete operations.
trans-unit.target: The Connector will delta import add, update, and delete operations.

trans-unit.source: This operation is using Notes's native C++ interfaces.
trans-unit.target: This operation is using Notes's native C++ interfaces.

trans-unit.source: In **Schema Options** you have the following options:
trans-unit.target: In **Schema Options** you have the following options:

trans-unit.source: **Default Schema**.
trans-unit.target: **Default Schema**.

trans-unit.source: The default option and the Connector will detect the schema from the Domino server.
trans-unit.target: The default option and the Connector will detect the schema from the Domino server.

trans-unit.source: **DSML-Schema**.
trans-unit.target: **DSML-Schema**.

trans-unit.source: Only used if the Domino server does not expose the schema.
trans-unit.target: Only used if the Domino server does not expose the schema.

trans-unit.source: Then you can create a DSML file with the schema and import it instead.
trans-unit.target: Then you can create a DSML file with the schema and import it instead.

trans-unit.source: For more information on DSML see [OASIS](https://www.oasis-open.org/committees/tc_home.php?wg_abbrev=dsml).
trans-unit.target: For more information on DSML see [OASIS](https://www.oasis-open.org/committees/tc_home.php?wg_abbrev=dsml).

trans-unit.source: When you click Next, the UserID and password configuration parameters are verified.
trans-unit.target: When you click Next, the UserID and password configuration parameters are verified.

trans-unit.source: Global Parameters
trans-unit.target: Global Parameters

trans-unit.source: On the Global Parameters page, you configure the time zone and the import and export operation option.
trans-unit.target: On the Global Parameters page, you configure the time zone and the import and export operation option.

trans-unit.source: Global Parameters
trans-unit.target: Global Parameters

trans-unit.source: The **Domino Server Time Zone** parameter defines the location of your Domino Server.
trans-unit.target: The **Domino Server Time Zone** parameter defines the location of your Domino Server.

trans-unit.source: This configuration option is required to support **delta import** operations because it enables the synchronization service determine changes between the last two imports.
trans-unit.target: This configuration option is required to support **delta import** operations because it enables the synchronization service determine changes between the last two imports.

trans-unit.source: Import settings, method
trans-unit.target: Import settings, method

trans-unit.source: The **Perform Full Import By** has these options:
trans-unit.target: The **Perform Full Import By** has these options:

trans-unit.source: Search
trans-unit.target: Search

trans-unit.source: View (Recommended)
trans-unit.target: View (Recommended)

trans-unit.source: **Search** is using indexing in Domino but it is common that the indexes are not updated in real-time and the data returned from the server is not always correct.
trans-unit.target: **Search** is using indexing in Domino but it is common that the indexes are not updated in real-time and the data returned from the server is not always correct.

trans-unit.source: For a system with many changes, this option usually doesn't work very well and provide false deletes in some situations.
trans-unit.target: For a system with many changes, this option usually doesn't work very well and provide false deletes in some situations.

trans-unit.source: However, **search** is faster than **view**.
trans-unit.target: However, **search** is faster than **view**.

trans-unit.source: **View** is the recommended option since it provides the correct state of data.
trans-unit.target: **View** is the recommended option since it provides the correct state of data.

trans-unit.source: It is slightly slower than search.
trans-unit.target: It is slightly slower than search.

trans-unit.source: Creation of Virtual Contact Objects
trans-unit.target: Creation of Virtual Contact Objects

trans-unit.source: The **Enable creation of \_Contact object** has these options:
trans-unit.target: The **Enable creation of \_Contact object** has these options:

trans-unit.source: None
trans-unit.target: None

trans-unit.source: Non-Reference Values
trans-unit.target: Non-Reference Values

trans-unit.source: Reference and Non-Reference Values
trans-unit.target: Reference and Non-Reference Values

trans-unit.source: In Domino, reference attributes can contain many different formats to reference other objects.
trans-unit.target: In Domino, reference attributes can contain many different formats to reference other objects.

trans-unit.source: To be able to represent different variations the Connector implements \_Contact objects, a.k.a.
trans-unit.target: To be able to represent different variations the Connector implements \_Contact objects, a.k.a.

trans-unit.source: as Virtual Contacts (VC).
trans-unit.target: as Virtual Contacts (VC).

trans-unit.source: These objects are created so they can be joined to existing MV objects and projected as new objects and in this way preserve reference attributes.
trans-unit.target: These objects are created so they can be joined to existing MV objects and projected as new objects and in this way preserve reference attributes.

trans-unit.source: By enabling this setting and if the content of a reference attribute is not a DN format, a \_Contact object is created.
trans-unit.target: By enabling this setting and if the content of a reference attribute is not a DN format, a \_Contact object is created.

trans-unit.source: For example, a member attribute of a group can contain SMTP addresses.
trans-unit.target: For example, a member attribute of a group can contain SMTP addresses.

trans-unit.source: It is also possible to have shortName and other attributes present in reference attributes.
trans-unit.target: It is also possible to have shortName and other attributes present in reference attributes.

trans-unit.source: For this scenario, select **Non-Reference Values**.
trans-unit.target: For this scenario, select **Non-Reference Values**.

trans-unit.source: This is the most common setting for Domino implementations.
trans-unit.target: This is the most common setting for Domino implementations.

trans-unit.source: When Lotus Domino is configured to have separate address books with different distinguished names representing the same object, it's possible to also create \_Contact objects for all reference values that are found in an address book.
trans-unit.target: When Lotus Domino is configured to have separate address books with different distinguished names representing the same object, it's possible to also create \_Contact objects for all reference values that are found in an address book.

trans-unit.source: For this scenario, select the **Reference and Non-Reference Values** option.
trans-unit.target: For this scenario, select the **Reference and Non-Reference Values** option.

trans-unit.source: If you have multiple values in the attribute **FullName** in Domino then you also want to enable the creation of Virtual Contacts so references can be resolved.
trans-unit.target: If you have multiple values in the attribute **FullName** in Domino then you also want to enable the creation of Virtual Contacts so references can be resolved.

trans-unit.source: This attribute can have multiple values after a marriage or divorce.
trans-unit.target: This attribute can have multiple values after a marriage or divorce.

trans-unit.source: Select the checkbox **Enable ... FullName has multiple values** for this scenario.
trans-unit.target: Select the checkbox **Enable ... FullName has multiple values** for this scenario.

trans-unit.source: By joining on the correct attributes, the \_Contact objects would be joined to the MV object.
trans-unit.target: By joining on the correct attributes, the \_Contact objects would be joined to the MV object.

trans-unit.source: These objects will have VC=\_Contact added to their DN.
trans-unit.target: These objects will have VC=\_Contact added to their DN.

trans-unit.source: Import settings, conflict object
trans-unit.target: Import settings, conflict object

trans-unit.source: Exclude Conflict Object
trans-unit.target: Exclude Conflict Object

trans-unit.source: In a large Domino implementation, it is possible that multiple objects have the same DN due to replication issues.
trans-unit.target: In a large Domino implementation, it is possible that multiple objects have the same DN due to replication issues.

trans-unit.source: In these cases, the connector would see two objects with different UniversalIDs but same DN.
trans-unit.target: In these cases, the connector would see two objects with different UniversalIDs but same DN.

trans-unit.source: This would cause a transient object being created in the connector space.
trans-unit.target: This would cause a transient object being created in the connector space.

trans-unit.source: The Connector can ignore the objects that have been selected in Domino as replication victims.
trans-unit.target: The Connector can ignore the objects that have been selected in Domino as replication victims.

trans-unit.source: It is recommended to keep this checkbox selected.
trans-unit.target: It is recommended to keep this checkbox selected.

trans-unit.source: Export settings
trans-unit.target: Export settings

trans-unit.source: If the option **Use AdminP for updating references** is unselected then export of reference attributes, such as member, will be a direct call and will not use the AdminP process.
trans-unit.target: If the option **Use AdminP for updating references** is unselected then export of reference attributes, such as member, will be a direct call and will not use the AdminP process.

trans-unit.source: This should only be used if AdminP has not been configured to maintain referential integrity.
trans-unit.target: This should only be used if AdminP has not been configured to maintain referential integrity.

trans-unit.source: Routing Information
trans-unit.target: Routing Information

trans-unit.source: In Domino, it is possible that a reference attribute has routing information embedded as a suffix to the DN.
trans-unit.target: In Domino, it is possible that a reference attribute has routing information embedded as a suffix to the DN.

trans-unit.source: For example the member attribute in a group could contain **CN=example/organization@ABC**.
trans-unit.target: For example the member attribute in a group could contain **CN=example/organization@ABC**.

trans-unit.source: The suffix @ABC is the routing information.
trans-unit.target: The suffix @ABC is the routing information.

trans-unit.source: The routing information is used by Domino to send emails to the correct Domino system, which could be a system in a different organization.
trans-unit.target: The routing information is used by Domino to send emails to the correct Domino system, which could be a system in a different organization.

trans-unit.source: In the Routing Information field you can specify the routing suffixes used within the organization in scope of the Connector.
trans-unit.target: In the Routing Information field you can specify the routing suffixes used within the organization in scope of the Connector.

trans-unit.source: If one of these values is found as a suffix in a reference attribute, the routing information is removed from the reference so it will match the DN for the object in the Connector space.
trans-unit.target: If one of these values is found as a suffix in a reference attribute, the routing information is removed from the reference so it will match the DN for the object in the Connector space.

trans-unit.source: If the routing suffix on a reference value cannot be matched to one of those specified, a \_Contact object is created.
trans-unit.target: If the routing suffix on a reference value cannot be matched to one of those specified, a \_Contact object is created.

trans-unit.source: These \_Contact objects will be created with **RO=@<RoutingSuffix>** inserted into the DN.
trans-unit.target: These \_Contact objects will be created with **RO=@<RoutingSuffix>** inserted into the DN.

trans-unit.source: For these \_Contact objects the following attributes are also added to allow joining to a real object if necessary: \_routingName, \_contactName, \_displayName, and UniversalID.
trans-unit.target: For these \_Contact objects the following attributes are also added to allow joining to a real object if necessary: \_routingName, \_contactName, \_displayName, and UniversalID.

trans-unit.source: Additional address books
trans-unit.target: Additional address books

trans-unit.source: If you do not have **directory assistance** installed, which will provide the name of secondary address books, then you can manually enter these address books.

trans-unit.source: Multivalued Transformation
trans-unit.target: Multivalued Transformation

trans-unit.source: Many attributes in Lotus Domino are multi-valued.
trans-unit.target: Many attributes in Lotus Domino are multi-valued.

trans-unit.source: The corresponding metaverse attributes are typically single valued.
trans-unit.target: The corresponding metaverse attributes are typically single valued.

trans-unit.source: By configuring the Import and the Export operation option, you enable the connector to help with the required translation of the affected attributes, which simplifies the configuration.
trans-unit.target: By configuring the Import and the Export operation option, you enable the connector to help with the required translation of the affected attributes, which simplifies the configuration.

trans-unit.source: Export
trans-unit.target: Export

trans-unit.source: The Export operation option supports two modes:
trans-unit.target: The Export operation option supports two modes:

trans-unit.source: Append item
trans-unit.target: Append item

trans-unit.source: Replace item
trans-unit.target: Replace item

trans-unit.source: **Replace Item** – When you select this option, the connector will always remove the current values of the attribute in Domino and replace them with the provided values.
trans-unit.target: **Replace Item** – When you select this option, the connector will always remove the current values of the attribute in Domino and replace them with the provided values.

trans-unit.source: The provided valued can be either single-valued or multi-valued.
trans-unit.target: The provided valued can be either single-valued or multi-valued.

trans-unit.source: Example:
trans-unit.target: Example:

trans-unit.source: The Assistant attribute of a person object has the following values:
trans-unit.target: The Assistant attribute of a person object has the following values:

trans-unit.source: CN=Greg Winston/OU= Contoso /O=Americas,NAB=names.nsf
trans-unit.target: CN=Greg Winston/OU= Contoso /O=Americas,NAB=names.nsf

trans-unit.source: CN=John Smith/OU= Contoso /O=Americas,NAB=names.nsf
trans-unit.target: CN=John Smith/OU= Contoso /O=Americas,NAB=names.nsf

trans-unit.source: If a new Assistant named **David Alexander** is assigned to this person object, the result is:
trans-unit.target: If a new Assistant named **David Alexander** is assigned to this person object, the result is:

trans-unit.source: CN=David Alexander/OU= Contoso /O=Americas,NAB=names.nsf
trans-unit.target: CN=David Alexander/OU= Contoso /O=Americas,NAB=names.nsf

trans-unit.source: **Append Item** – When you select this option, the connector will retain the existing values on the attribute in Domino and insert new values at the top of the data list.
trans-unit.target: **Append Item** – When you select this option, the connector will retain the existing values on the attribute in Domino and insert new values at the top of the data list.

trans-unit.source: Example:
trans-unit.target: Example:

trans-unit.source: The Assistant attribute of a person object has the following values:
trans-unit.target: The Assistant attribute of a person object has the following values:

trans-unit.source: CN=Greg Winston/OU= Contoso /O=Americas,NAB=names.nsf
trans-unit.target: CN=Greg Winston/OU= Contoso /O=Americas,NAB=names.nsf

trans-unit.source: CN=John Smith/OU= Contoso /O=Americas,NAB=names.nsf
trans-unit.target: CN=John Smith/OU= Contoso /O=Americas,NAB=names.nsf

trans-unit.source: If a new Assistant named **David Alexander** is assigned to this person object, the result is:
trans-unit.target: If a new Assistant named **David Alexander** is assigned to this person object, the result is:

trans-unit.source: CN=David Alexander/OU= Contoso /O=Americas,NAB=names.nsf
trans-unit.target: CN=David Alexander/OU= Contoso /O=Americas,NAB=names.nsf

trans-unit.source: CN=Greg Winston/OU= Contoso /O=Americas,NAB=names.nsf
trans-unit.target: CN=Greg Winston/OU= Contoso /O=Americas,NAB=names.nsf

trans-unit.source: Import
trans-unit.target: Import

trans-unit.source: The Export operation option supports two modes:
trans-unit.target: The Export operation option supports two modes:

trans-unit.source: Default
trans-unit.target: Default

trans-unit.source: Multivalued to Single Value
trans-unit.target: Multivalued to Single Value

trans-unit.source: **Default** – When you select the Default option all values of all the attributes will be imported.
trans-unit.target: **Default** – When you select the Default option all values of all the attributes will be imported.

trans-unit.source: **Multivalued to Single Value** – When you select this option, a multi-valued attribute is converted into a single-valued attribute.
trans-unit.target: **Multivalued to Single Value** – When you select this option, a multi-valued attribute is converted into a single-valued attribute.

trans-unit.source: If more than one value exists, the value on the top (this is typically also the latest value) will be used.
trans-unit.target: If more than one value exists, the value on the top (this is typically also the latest value) will be used.

trans-unit.source: Example:
trans-unit.target: Example:

trans-unit.source: The Assistant attribute of a person object has the following values:
trans-unit.target: The Assistant attribute of a person object has the following values:

trans-unit.source: CN=David Alexander/OU= Contoso /O=Americas,NAB=names.nsf
trans-unit.target: CN=David Alexander/OU= Contoso /O=Americas,NAB=names.nsf

trans-unit.source: CN=Greg Winston/OU= Contoso /O=Americas,NAB=names.nsf
trans-unit.target: CN=Greg Winston/OU= Contoso /O=Americas,NAB=names.nsf

trans-unit.source: CN=John Smith/OU= Contoso /O=Americas,NAB=names.nsf
trans-unit.target: CN=John Smith/OU= Contoso /O=Americas,NAB=names.nsf

trans-unit.source: The most recent update to this attribute is **David Alexander**.
trans-unit.target: The most recent update to this attribute is **David Alexander**.

trans-unit.source: Because the Import operation option is set to Multivalued to Single Value, connector only imports **David Alexander** into the connector space.
trans-unit.target: Because the Import operation option is set to Multivalued to Single Value, connector only imports **David Alexander** into the connector space.

trans-unit.source: The logic to convert multi-valued attributes into single-valued attributes does not apply to member attribute of a group object and to the fullname attribute of a person object.
trans-unit.target: The logic to convert multi-valued attributes into single-valued attributes does not apply to member attribute of a group object and to the fullname attribute of a person object.

trans-unit.source: It also possible to configure import and export transformation rules for multivalued attributes per attribute, as an exception to the global rule.
trans-unit.target: It also possible to configure import and export transformation rules for multivalued attributes per attribute, as an exception to the global rule.

trans-unit.source: To configure this option, enter [objecttype].[attributename] in the **import exclusion attribute list** and **export exclusion attribute list** text boxes.
trans-unit.target: To configure this option, enter [objecttype].[attributename] in the **import exclusion attribute list** and **export exclusion attribute list** text boxes.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you enter Person.Assistant and the global flag is set to import all values, only the first value will be imported for the assistant.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you enter Person.Assistant and the global flag is set to import all values, only the first value will be imported for the assistant.

trans-unit.source: This section provides an overview of the different objects in Domino.
trans-unit.target: This section provides an overview of the different objects in Domino.

trans-unit.source: Person Objects
trans-unit.target: Person Objects

trans-unit.source: The person object represents users in Organization and Organization Units.
trans-unit.target: The person object represents users in Organization and Organization Units.

trans-unit.source: In addition to the default attributes, the Domino administrator can add custom attributes to a Person object.
trans-unit.target: In addition to the default attributes, the Domino administrator can add custom attributes to a Person object.

trans-unit.source: At a minimum, a Person object must include all mandatory attributes.
trans-unit.target: At a minimum, a Person object must include all mandatory attributes.

trans-unit.source: For a complete list of mandatory attributes, see [Lotus Notes Properties](#lotus-notes-properties).
trans-unit.target: For a complete list of mandatory attributes, see [Lotus Notes Properties](#lotus-notes-properties).

trans-unit.source: In order to register a person object, the following prerequisites must be met
trans-unit.target: In order to register a person object, the following prerequisites must be met

trans-unit.source: The address book (names.nsf) should have been defined and it should be the primary address book.
trans-unit.target: The address book (names.nsf) should have been defined and it should be the primary address book.

trans-unit.source: You should have the O/OU certifier Id and the password to register a particular user in the Organization / Organization Unit.
trans-unit.target: You should have the O/OU certifier Id and the password to register a particular user in the Organization / Organization Unit.

trans-unit.source: You need to define a specific set of Lotus Notes properties for a person object.
trans-unit.target: You need to define a specific set of Lotus Notes properties for a person object.

trans-unit.source: These are used for provisioning the person object.
trans-unit.target: These are used for provisioning the person object.

trans-unit.source: For more details, see the section called [Lotus Notes Properties](#lotus-notes-properties) later in this document.
trans-unit.target: For more details, see the section called [Lotus Notes Properties](#lotus-notes-properties) later in this document.

trans-unit.source: The initial HTTP password for a person is an attribute and set during provisioning.
trans-unit.target: The initial HTTP password for a person is an attribute and set during provisioning.

trans-unit.source: The person object must be one of the following three supported types:
trans-unit.target: The person object must be one of the following three supported types:

trans-unit.source: Normal User that has a mail file and a user id file
trans-unit.target: Normal User that has a mail file and a user id file

trans-unit.source: Roaming User (a Normal User that includes all roaming database files)
trans-unit.target: Roaming User (a Normal User that includes all roaming database files)

trans-unit.source: Contacts (user with no id file)
trans-unit.target: Contacts (user with no id file)

trans-unit.source: Persons (with the exception of contacts) can further be grouped into US Users and International Users as defined by the value of the \_MMS\_IDRegType property.
trans-unit.target: Persons (with the exception of contacts) can further be grouped into US Users and International Users as defined by the value of the \_MMS\_IDRegType property.

trans-unit.source: These are the people using the Notes Client to access Lotus Domino servers, database, have a Notes Id, and a Person document.
trans-unit.target: These are the people using the Notes Client to access Lotus Domino servers, database, have a Notes Id, and a Person document.

trans-unit.source: If they are using Notes mail, then they will also have a mail file.
trans-unit.target: If they are using Notes mail, then they will also have a mail file.

trans-unit.source: The user must be registered to become active.
trans-unit.target: The user must be registered to become active.

trans-unit.source: For more information see:
trans-unit.target: For more information see:

trans-unit.target: User Registration

trans-unit.source: Resources can be conference rooms with various types of equipment such as projectors.
trans-unit.target: Resources can be conference rooms with various types of equipment such as projectors.

trans-unit.source: Create, Update and Delete Resources
trans-unit.target: Create, Update and Delete Resources

trans-unit.source: The Create, Update and Delete operations are performed by the Lotus Domino connector in the Resource Reservation database.
trans-unit.target: The Create, Update and Delete operations are performed by the Lotus Domino connector in the Resource Reservation database.

trans-unit.source: As a result of this, resources are created as documents in Names.nsf (i.e. the primary address book).

trans-unit.source: Import and Export operation for Resources
trans-unit.target: Import and Export operation for Resources

trans-unit.source: The Resources can be imported to and exported from the synchronization service just like any other object type.
trans-unit.target: The Resources can be imported to and exported from the synchronization service just like any other object type.

trans-unit.source: You should select the object type as Resource during configuration.
trans-unit.target: You should select the object type as Resource during configuration.

trans-unit.source: For successful export operation, you should have details for Resource type, Conference Database, and Site name.
trans-unit.target: For successful export operation, you should have details for Resource type, Conference Database, and Site name.

trans-unit.source: Mail-In Databases
trans-unit.target: Mail-In Databases

trans-unit.source: A Mail-In Database is a database that is designed to receive mails.
trans-unit.target: A Mail-In Database is a database that is designed to receive mails.

trans-unit.source: It is a Lotus Domino mailbox (Notes database based on the Mail template) that is not associated with any specific Lotus Domino user account (i.e. it does not have its own ID file and password).
trans-unit.target: It is a Lotus Domino mailbox (Notes database based on the Mail template) that is not associated with any specific Lotus Domino user account (i.e. it does not have its own ID file and password).

trans-unit.source: A mail-in database has a unique UserID ("short name") associated with it and its own e-mail address.
trans-unit.target: A mail-in database has a unique UserID ("short name") associated with it and its own e-mail address.

trans-unit.source: Each user requires only one Lotus Domino account.
trans-unit.target: Each user requires only one Lotus Domino account.

trans-unit.source: If there is a need for a separate mailbox with its own e-mail address that can be shared among different users (e.g.: group@contoso.com), a mail-in database is created instead of an additional Notes account.
trans-unit.target: If there is a need for a separate mailbox with its own e-mail address that can be shared among different users (e.g.: group@contoso.com), a mail-in database is created instead of an additional Notes account.

trans-unit.source: The access to this mailbox is controlled through its Access Control List (ACL), which contains the names of the Notes users that are allowed to open the mailbox using their own ID files and passwords.
trans-unit.target: The access to this mailbox is controlled through its Access Control List (ACL), which contains the names of the Notes users that are allowed to open the mailbox using their own ID files and passwords.

trans-unit.source: There is no separate password required to access a mail-in database.
trans-unit.target: There is no separate password required to access a mail-in database.

trans-unit.source: For a list of the required attributes, see the section called [Mandatory Attributes](#mandatory-attributes) later in this article .
trans-unit.target: For a list of the required attributes, see the section called [Mandatory Attributes](#mandatory-attributes) later in this article .

trans-unit.source: When a database is designed to receive a mail, a Mail-In Database document is created in Lotus Domino.
trans-unit.target: When a database is designed to receive a mail, a Mail-In Database document is created in Lotus Domino.

trans-unit.source: This document must exist in Domino Directory of every server that stores a copy of the database.
trans-unit.target: This document must exist in Domino Directory of every server that stores a copy of the database.

trans-unit.source: For a detailed description about creating a mail-in database document see [Creating a Mail-In Database document](http://publib.boulder.ibm.com/infocenter/domhelp/v8r0/index.jsp?topic=/com.ibm.help.domino.admin85.doc/H_CREATING_A_MAILIN_DATABASE_DOCUMENT_FOR_A_NEW_DATABASE_OVERVIEW.html).
trans-unit.target: For a detailed description about creating a mail-in database document see [Creating a Mail-In Database document](http://publib.boulder.ibm.com/infocenter/domhelp/v8r0/index.jsp?topic=/com.ibm.help.domino.admin85.doc/H_CREATING_A_MAILIN_DATABASE_DOCUMENT_FOR_A_NEW_DATABASE_OVERVIEW.html).

trans-unit.source: Before creating a Mail-In Database, the database should already exist (should have been created by Lotus Admin) at the Domino server.
trans-unit.target: Before creating a Mail-In Database, the database should already exist (should have been created by Lotus Admin) at the Domino server.

trans-unit.source: Password Management

trans-unit.source: For a registered Lotus Domino user, there are two types of passwords:

trans-unit.source: User password (Stored in User.id file)

trans-unit.source: Internet / HTTP password
trans-unit.target: Internet / HTTP password

trans-unit.source: The Lotus Domino connector supports only operations with HTTP password.
trans-unit.target: The Lotus Domino connector supports only operations with HTTP password.

trans-unit.source: In order to perform password management, you should enable password management for the connector in the Management Agent Designer.
trans-unit.target: In order to perform password management, you should enable password management for the connector in the Management Agent Designer.

trans-unit.source: To enable password management, select **Enable password management** on the **Configure Extensions** dialog page.
trans-unit.target: To enable password management, select **Enable password management** on the **Configure Extensions** dialog page.

trans-unit.source: Configure Extensions
trans-unit.target: Configure Extensions

trans-unit.source: The Lotus Domino connector support following operations on Internet password:
trans-unit.target: The Lotus Domino connector support following operations on Internet password:

trans-unit.source: Set Password: Set password will set a new HTTP/Internet password on the user in Domino.
trans-unit.target: Set Password: Set password will set a new HTTP/Internet password on the user in Domino.

trans-unit.source: By default the account will also be unlocked.
trans-unit.target: By default the account will also be unlocked.

trans-unit.source: The unlock flag is exposed on the WMI interface of the Sync Engine.
trans-unit.target: The unlock flag is exposed on the WMI interface of the Sync Engine.

trans-unit.source: Change Password: In this scenario, a user might want to change the password or is prompted to change password after a specified time.
trans-unit.target: Change Password: In this scenario, a user might want to change the password or is prompted to change password after a specified time.

trans-unit.source: For this operation to take place, both (the old and the new password) are mandatory.
trans-unit.target: For this operation to take place, both (the old and the new password) are mandatory.

trans-unit.source: Once changed, the new password is updated in Lotus Domino.
trans-unit.target: Once changed, the new password is updated in Lotus Domino.

trans-unit.target: For more information, see:

trans-unit.source: Lotus Notes Properties
trans-unit.target: Lotus Notes Properties

trans-unit.source: When you provision Person objects to your Lotus Domino directory, your objects must have a specific set of properties with specific values populated.
trans-unit.target: When you provision Person objects to your Lotus Domino directory, your objects must have a specific set of properties with specific values populated.

trans-unit.source: These values are only required for Create operations.
trans-unit.target: These values are only required for Create operations.

trans-unit.source: The following table lists these properties and provides a description of them.
trans-unit.target: The following table lists these properties and provides a description of them.

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: \_MMS_AltFullName
trans-unit.target: \_MMS_AltFullName

trans-unit.source: The alternate full name of user.
trans-unit.target: The alternate full name of user.

trans-unit.source: \_MMS_AltFullNameLanguage
trans-unit.target: \_MMS_AltFullNameLanguage

trans-unit.source: The language to be used for specifying the alternate full name of user.
trans-unit.target: The language to be used for specifying the alternate full name of user.

trans-unit.source: \_MMS_CertDaysToExpire
trans-unit.target: \_MMS_CertDaysToExpire

trans-unit.source: The number of days from the current date before the certificate expires.
trans-unit.target: The number of days from the current date before the certificate expires.

trans-unit.source: If not specified, the default date is two years from the current date.
trans-unit.target: If not specified, the default date is two years from the current date.

trans-unit.source: \_MMS_Certifier
trans-unit.target: \_MMS_Certifier

trans-unit.source: Property that contains the organizational hierarchy name of the certifier.
trans-unit.target: Property that contains the organizational hierarchy name of the certifier.

trans-unit.source: For Example: OU=OrganizationUnit,O=Org,C=Country.
trans-unit.target: For Example: OU=OrganizationUnit,O=Org,C=Country.

trans-unit.source: \_MMS_IDPath
trans-unit.target: \_MMS_IDPath

trans-unit.source: If the property is empty, no user identification file is created locally on the Sync Server.
trans-unit.target: If the property is empty, no user identification file is created locally on the Sync Server.

trans-unit.source: If the property contains a file name, a user ID file is created in the madata folder.
trans-unit.target: If the property contains a file name, a user ID file is created in the madata folder.

trans-unit.source: The property can also contain a full path in which the user ID file is created in this location.
trans-unit.target: The property can also contain a full path in which the user ID file is created in this location.

trans-unit.source: \_MMS_IDRegType
trans-unit.target: \_MMS_IDRegType

trans-unit.source: Persons can be classified into contacts.
trans-unit.target: Persons can be classified into contacts.

trans-unit.source: US Users and international Users.
trans-unit.target: US Users and international Users.

trans-unit.source: The following table lists the possible values:
trans-unit.target: The following table lists the possible values:

trans-unit.source: 0 - Contact
trans-unit.target: 0 - Contact

trans-unit.source: user
trans-unit.target: user

trans-unit.source: 2 - International user
trans-unit.target: 2 - International user

trans-unit.source: \_MMS_IDStoreType
trans-unit.target: \_MMS_IDStoreType

trans-unit.source: Required property for U.S.
trans-unit.target: Required property for U.S.

trans-unit.source: and international users.
trans-unit.target: and international users.

trans-unit.source: The property contains an integer value that specifies whether the user identification is stored as an attachment in the Notes address book or in the person’s mail file.
trans-unit.target: The property contains an integer value that specifies whether the user identification is stored as an attachment in the Notes address book or in the person’s mail file.

trans-unit.source: If the User ID file is an attachment in the address book, it can optionally be created as a file with \_MMS_IDPath.
trans-unit.target: If the User ID file is an attachment in the address book, it can optionally be created as a file with \_MMS_IDPath.

trans-unit.source: Empty - Store ID file in ID Vault, No identification file (used for Contacts).
trans-unit.target: Empty - Store ID file in ID Vault, No identification file (used for Contacts).

trans-unit.source: 1 - Attachment in the Notes address book.
trans-unit.target: 1 - Attachment in the Notes address book.

trans-unit.source: The \_MMS_Password property must be set for user identification files that are attachments
trans-unit.target: The \_MMS_Password property must be set for user identification files that are attachments

trans-unit.source: 2 - Store ID in person’s Mail File.
trans-unit.target: 2 - Store ID in person’s Mail File.

trans-unit.source: The \_MMS_UseAdminP must be set to false to let the mail file be created during the Person registration.The \_MMS_Password property must be set for user identification files.
trans-unit.target: The \_MMS_UseAdminP must be set to false to let the mail file be created during the Person registration.The \_MMS_Password property must be set for user identification files.

trans-unit.source: \_MMS_MailQuotaSizeLimit
trans-unit.target: \_MMS_MailQuotaSizeLimit

trans-unit.source: The number of megabytes that are allowed for the e-mail file database.
trans-unit.target: The number of megabytes that are allowed for the e-mail file database.

trans-unit.source: \_MMS_MailQuotaWarningThreshold
trans-unit.target: \_MMS_MailQuotaWarningThreshold

trans-unit.source: The number of megabytes that are allowed for the e-mail file database before a warning is issued.
trans-unit.target: The number of megabytes that are allowed for the e-mail file database before a warning is issued.

trans-unit.source: \_MMS_MailTemplateName
trans-unit.target: \_MMS_MailTemplateName

trans-unit.source: The e-mail template file that is used to create the user's e-mail file.
trans-unit.target: The e-mail template file that is used to create the user's e-mail file.

trans-unit.source: If a template is specified, the mail file is created using the specified template.
trans-unit.target: If a template is specified, the mail file is created using the specified template.

trans-unit.source: If no template is specified, the default template file is used to create the file.
trans-unit.target: If no template is specified, the default template file is used to create the file.

trans-unit.source: \_MMS_OU
trans-unit.target: \_MMS_OU

trans-unit.source: Optional property that is the OU name under the certifier.
trans-unit.target: Optional property that is the OU name under the certifier.

trans-unit.source: This property should be empty for contacts.
trans-unit.target: This property should be empty for contacts.

trans-unit.source: \_MMS_Password
trans-unit.target: \_MMS_Password

trans-unit.source: Required property for users.
trans-unit.target: Required property for users.

trans-unit.source: The property contains the password for the identification file of the object.
trans-unit.target: The property contains the password for the identification file of the object.

trans-unit.source: \_MMS_UseAdminP
trans-unit.target: \_MMS_UseAdminP

trans-unit.source: Property should be set to true if the mail file should be created by the AdminP process on the Domino server (asynchronous to the export process).
trans-unit.target: Property should be set to true if the mail file should be created by the AdminP process on the Domino server (asynchronous to the export process).

trans-unit.source: If property is set to false the mail file is created with the Domino user (synchronous in the export process).
trans-unit.target: If property is set to false the mail file is created with the Domino user (synchronous in the export process).

trans-unit.source: For a user with an associated identification file, the \_MMS_Password property must contain a value.
trans-unit.target: For a user with an associated identification file, the \_MMS_Password property must contain a value.

trans-unit.source: For e-mail access through the Lotus Notes client, the MailServer and MailFile properties of a user must contain a value.
trans-unit.target: For e-mail access through the Lotus Notes client, the MailServer and MailFile properties of a user must contain a value.

trans-unit.source: To access e-mail through a Web browser, the following properties must contain values:
trans-unit.target: To access e-mail through a Web browser, the following properties must contain values:

trans-unit.source: MailFile - Required property that contains the path on the Lotus Domino server where the mail file is stored.
trans-unit.target: MailFile - Required property that contains the path on the Lotus Domino server where the mail file is stored.

trans-unit.source: MailServer - Required property that contains the name of the Lotus Domino server.
trans-unit.target: MailServer - Required property that contains the name of the Lotus Domino server.

trans-unit.source: This is the name to use when you create the Lotus mail file on the Domino server.
trans-unit.target: This is the name to use when you create the Lotus mail file on the Domino server.

trans-unit.source: HTTPPassword - Optional property that contains the Web access password for the object.
trans-unit.target: HTTPPassword - Optional property that contains the Web access password for the object.

trans-unit.source: To access the Domino Server without mail capability, the HTTPPassword property must contain a value, and the MailFile property and the MailServer property can be empty.
trans-unit.target: To access the Domino Server without mail capability, the HTTPPassword property must contain a value, and the MailFile property and the MailServer property can be empty.

trans-unit.source: With \_MMS_ IDStoreType = 2 (store id in Mail file), the MailSystem property of NotesRegistrationclass will be set to REG_MAILSYSTEM_INOTES (3).
trans-unit.target: With \_MMS_ IDStoreType = 2 (store id in Mail file), the MailSystem property of NotesRegistrationclass will be set to REG_MAILSYSTEM_INOTES (3).

trans-unit.source: Common issues and questions
trans-unit.target: Common issues and questions

trans-unit.source: Schema detection does not work
trans-unit.target: Schema detection does not work

trans-unit.source: To be able to detect the schema it is necessary that the schema.nsf file is present on the Domino server.
trans-unit.target: To be able to detect the schema it is necessary that the schema.nsf file is present on the Domino server.

trans-unit.source: This file will only appear if LDAP is installed on the server.
trans-unit.target: This file will only appear if LDAP is installed on the server.

trans-unit.source: If the schema is not detectable, please verify the following:
trans-unit.target: If the schema is not detectable, please verify the following:

trans-unit.source: The file schema.nsf is present at the root folder of the Domino Server
trans-unit.target: The file schema.nsf is present at the root folder of the Domino Server

trans-unit.source: The user has permissions to see the schema.nsf file.
trans-unit.target: The user has permissions to see the schema.nsf file.

trans-unit.source: Force a restart of the LDAP server.
trans-unit.target: Force a restart of the LDAP server.

trans-unit.source: Open ‘Lotus Domino Console’ and use ‘Tell LDAP ReloadSchema’ command to reload the schema.
trans-unit.target: Open ‘Lotus Domino Console’ and use ‘Tell LDAP ReloadSchema’ command to reload the schema.

trans-unit.source: Not all secondary address books are visible
trans-unit.target: Not all secondary address books are visible

trans-unit.source: The Domino Connector relies on the feature Directory Assistance to be able to find the secondary address books.
trans-unit.target: The Domino Connector relies on the feature Directory Assistance to be able to find the secondary address books.

trans-unit.source: If the secondary address books are missing, please verify if [Directory Assistance](http://publib.boulder.ibm.com/infocenter/domhelp/v8r0/index.jsp?topic=%2Fcom.ibm.help.domino.admin85.doc%2FH_ABOUT_DIRECTORY_ASSISTANCE.html) has been enabled and configured on the Domino Server.
trans-unit.target: If the secondary address books are missing, please verify if [Directory Assistance](http://publib.boulder.ibm.com/infocenter/domhelp/v8r0/index.jsp?topic=%2Fcom.ibm.help.domino.admin85.doc%2FH_ABOUT_DIRECTORY_ASSISTANCE.html) has been enabled and configured on the Domino Server.

trans-unit.source: Custom attributes in Domino
trans-unit.target: Custom attributes in Domino

trans-unit.source: There are several ways in Domino to extend the schema so it will appear as a custom attribute consumable by the Connector.
trans-unit.target: There are several ways in Domino to extend the schema so it will appear as a custom attribute consumable by the Connector.

trans-unit.source: Approach 1: Extend Lotus Domino schema
trans-unit.target: Approach 1: Extend Lotus Domino schema

trans-unit.source: Create a copy of Domino Directory Template <PUBNAMES.NTF> by following [these steps](http://publib.boulder.ibm.com/infocenter/domhelp/v8r0/index.jsp?topic=%2Fcom.ibm.help.domino.admin85.doc%2FH_CREATING_A_COPY_OF_THE_DEFAULT_PUBIC_ADDRESS_BOOK_TEMPLATE.html) (you should not customize the default IBM Lotus Domino directory Template):
trans-unit.target: Create a copy of Domino Directory Template <PUBNAMES.NTF> by following [these steps](http://publib.boulder.ibm.com/infocenter/domhelp/v8r0/index.jsp?topic=%2Fcom.ibm.help.domino.admin85.doc%2FH_CREATING_A_COPY_OF_THE_DEFAULT_PUBIC_ADDRESS_BOOK_TEMPLATE.html) (you should not customize the default IBM Lotus Domino directory Template):

trans-unit.source: Open Copy of Domino directory template <CONTOSO.NTF> template which is just created, in Domino Designer and follow the below steps:
trans-unit.target: Open Copy of Domino directory template <CONTOSO.NTF> template which is just created, in Domino Designer and follow the below steps:

trans-unit.source: Click on Shared Elements and expand Subforms
trans-unit.target: Click on Shared Elements and expand Subforms

trans-unit.source: Double click on $[ObjectName]InheritableSchema subform (where [ObjectName] is the name of the default structural object class ex: Person).
trans-unit.target: Double click on $[ObjectName]InheritableSchema subform (where [ObjectName] is the name of the default structural object class ex: Person).

trans-unit.source: Name the attribute you want to add into schema [MyPersonAtrribute] and corresponding to that create a field by selecting “Create” Menu and then select ‘Field’ from menu.
trans-unit.target: Name the attribute you want to add into schema [MyPersonAtrribute] and corresponding to that create a field by selecting “Create” Menu and then select ‘Field’ from menu.

trans-unit.source: In the added field, set its properties by selecting its Type, Style, size, font and other related parameters on field Properties window.
trans-unit.target: In the added field, set its properties by selecting its Type, Style, size, font and other related parameters on field Properties window.

trans-unit.source: Keep the attribute Default value same as the name given for that attribute (e.g. if attribute name is MyPersonAttribute, keep the default value with the same name).
trans-unit.target: Keep the attribute Default value same as the name given for that attribute (e.g. if attribute name is MyPersonAttribute, keep the default value with the same name).

trans-unit.source: Save the $[ObjectName]InheritableSchema subform with updated values
trans-unit.target: Save the $[ObjectName]InheritableSchema subform with updated values

trans-unit.source: Replace the Domino Directory Template <PUBNAMES.NTF> with the new customized template [CONTOSO.NTF] by following [these steps](http://publib.boulder.ibm.com/infocenter/domhelp/v8r0/index.jsp?topic=%2Fcom.ibm.help.domino.admin85.doc%2FH_ABOUT_RULES_FOR_CUSTOMIZING_THE_PUBLIC_ADDRESS_BOOK.html).
trans-unit.target: Replace the Domino Directory Template <PUBNAMES.NTF> with the new customized template [CONTOSO.NTF] by following [these steps](http://publib.boulder.ibm.com/infocenter/domhelp/v8r0/index.jsp?topic=%2Fcom.ibm.help.domino.admin85.doc%2FH_ABOUT_RULES_FOR_CUSTOMIZING_THE_PUBLIC_ADDRESS_BOOK.html).

trans-unit.source: Close Domino Admin and open Domino Console to restart the LDAP service and to Reload the LDAP Schema:
trans-unit.target: Close Domino Admin and open Domino Console to restart the LDAP service and to Reload the LDAP Schema:

trans-unit.source: In Domino Console insert the command under **Domino Command** text filed to restart the LDAP service - [Restart Task LDAP]( http://publib.boulder.ibm.com/infocenter/domhelp/v8r0/index.jsp?topic=%2Fcom.ibm.help.domino.admin85.doc%2FH_STARTING_AND_STOPPING_THE_LDAP_SERVER_OVER.html).
trans-unit.target: In Domino Console insert the command under **Domino Command** text filed to restart the LDAP service - [Restart Task LDAP]( http://publib.boulder.ibm.com/infocenter/domhelp/v8r0/index.jsp?topic=%2Fcom.ibm.help.domino.admin85.doc%2FH_STARTING_AND_STOPPING_THE_LDAP_SERVER_OVER.html).

trans-unit.source: To reload LDAP schema use Tell LDAP command - Tell LDAP ReloadSchema
trans-unit.target: To reload LDAP schema use Tell LDAP command - Tell LDAP ReloadSchema

trans-unit.source: Open Domino Admin and select People & Groups tab to see added attribute is reflected in domino Add Person
trans-unit.target: Open Domino Admin and select People & Groups tab to see added attribute is reflected in domino Add Person

trans-unit.source: Open Schema.nsf from ‘Files’ tab and see added attribute is reflected into dominoPerson LDAP object class
trans-unit.target: Open Schema.nsf from ‘Files’ tab and see added attribute is reflected into dominoPerson LDAP object class

trans-unit.source: Approach 2: Create an auxClass with custom attribute and associate with the object class
trans-unit.target: Approach 2: Create an auxClass with custom attribute and associate with the object class

trans-unit.source: Create a copy of Domino Directory Template [PUBNAMES.NTF] by following [these steps]()http://publib.boulder.ibm.com/infocenter/domhelp/v8r0/index.jsp?topic=%2Fcom.ibm.help.domino.admin85.doc%2FH_CREATING_A_COPY_OF_THE_DEFAULT_PUBIC_ADDRESS_BOOK_TEMPLATE.html (Never customize the default IBM Lotus Domino directory Template):
trans-unit.target: Create a copy of Domino Directory Template [PUBNAMES.NTF] by following [these steps]()http://publib.boulder.ibm.com/infocenter/domhelp/v8r0/index.jsp?topic=%2Fcom.ibm.help.domino.admin85.doc%2FH_CREATING_A_COPY_OF_THE_DEFAULT_PUBIC_ADDRESS_BOOK_TEMPLATE.html (Never customize the default IBM Lotus Domino directory Template):

trans-unit.source: Open Copy of Domino directory template [CONTOSO.NTF] template which is just created, in Domino Designer.
trans-unit.target: Open Copy of Domino directory template [CONTOSO.NTF] template which is just created, in Domino Designer.

trans-unit.source: In the left pane, select Shared Code and then Subforms.
trans-unit.target: In the left pane, select Shared Code and then Subforms.

trans-unit.source: Click New Subform
trans-unit.target: Click New Subform

trans-unit.source: Do the following to specify the properties for the new subform:
trans-unit.target: Do the following to specify the properties for the new subform:

trans-unit.source: With the new subform open, choose Design - Subform Properties
trans-unit.target: With the new subform open, choose Design - Subform Properties

trans-unit.source: Next to the Name property, enter a name for the auxiliary object class -- for example, TestSubform.
trans-unit.target: Next to the Name property, enter a name for the auxiliary object class -- for example, TestSubform.

trans-unit.source: Keep the Options property "Include in Insert Subform... dialog" selected
trans-unit.target: Keep the Options property "Include in Insert Subform... dialog" selected

trans-unit.source: Deselect the Options property "Render pass through HTML in Notes."
trans-unit.target: Deselect the Options property "Render pass through HTML in Notes."

trans-unit.source: Leave the other properties the same, and close the Subform Properties box.
trans-unit.target: Leave the other properties the same, and close the Subform Properties box.

trans-unit.source: Save and close the new subform.
trans-unit.target: Save and close the new subform.

trans-unit.source: Do the following to add a field to define the auxiliary object class:
trans-unit.target: Do the following to add a field to define the auxiliary object class:

trans-unit.source: Open the subform you just created.
trans-unit.target: Open the subform you just created.

trans-unit.source: Choose Create - Field.
trans-unit.target: Choose Create - Field.

trans-unit.source: Next to Name on the Basics tab of the Field dialog box, specify any name, for example: [MyPersonTestAttribute].
trans-unit.target: Next to Name on the Basics tab of the Field dialog box, specify any name, for example: [MyPersonTestAttribute].

trans-unit.source: In the added field, set its properties by selecting its Type, Style, size, font and related properties.
trans-unit.target: In the added field, set its properties by selecting its Type, Style, size, font and related properties.

trans-unit.source: Keep the attribute Default value same as the name given for that attribute (e.g. if attribute name is MyPersonTestAttribute, keep the default value with the same name).
trans-unit.target: Keep the attribute Default value same as the name given for that attribute (e.g. if attribute name is MyPersonTestAttribute, keep the default value with the same name).

trans-unit.source: Save the subform with updated values and do the following:
trans-unit.target: Save the subform with updated values and do the following:

trans-unit.source: In the left pane, select Shared Code and then Subforms
trans-unit.target: In the left pane, select Shared Code and then Subforms

trans-unit.source: Select the new subform, and choose Design - Design Properties.
trans-unit.target: Select the new subform, and choose Design - Design Properties.

trans-unit.source: Click the third tab from the left, and select **Propagate this prohibition of design change**.
trans-unit.target: Click the third tab from the left, and select **Propagate this prohibition of design change**.

trans-unit.source: Open $[ObjectName]ExtensibleSchema subform, (where [ObjectName] is the name of the default structural object class, say – Person).
trans-unit.target: Open $[ObjectName]ExtensibleSchema subform, (where [ObjectName] is the name of the default structural object class, say – Person).

trans-unit.source: Insert Resource and select the Subform (which you just created, say – TestSubform) and save the $[ObjectName]ExtensibleSchema subform.
trans-unit.target: Insert Resource and select the Subform (which you just created, say – TestSubform) and save the $[ObjectName]ExtensibleSchema subform.

trans-unit.source: Replace the Domino Directory Template [PUBNAMES.NTF] with the new customized template [CONTOSO.NTF] by following [these steps](http://publib.boulder.ibm.com/infocenter/domhelp/v8r0/index.jsp?topic=%2Fcom.ibm.help.domino.admin85.doc%2FH_ABOUT_RULES_FOR_CUSTOMIZING_THE_PUBLIC_ADDRESS_BOOK.html).
trans-unit.target: Replace the Domino Directory Template [PUBNAMES.NTF] with the new customized template [CONTOSO.NTF] by following [these steps](http://publib.boulder.ibm.com/infocenter/domhelp/v8r0/index.jsp?topic=%2Fcom.ibm.help.domino.admin85.doc%2FH_ABOUT_RULES_FOR_CUSTOMIZING_THE_PUBLIC_ADDRESS_BOOK.html).

trans-unit.source: Close Domino Admin and open Domino Console to restart the LDAP service and to Reload the LDAP Schema:
trans-unit.target: Close Domino Admin and open Domino Console to restart the LDAP service and to Reload the LDAP Schema:

trans-unit.source: In Domino Console insert the command under **Domino Command** text filed to restart the LDAP service - [Restart Task LDAP](http://publib.boulder.ibm.com/infocenter/domhelp/v8r0/index.jsp?topic=%2Fcom.ibm.help.domino.admin85.doc%2FH_STARTING_AND_STOPPING_THE_LDAP_SERVER_OVER.html).
trans-unit.target: In Domino Console insert the command under **Domino Command** text filed to restart the LDAP service - [Restart Task LDAP](http://publib.boulder.ibm.com/infocenter/domhelp/v8r0/index.jsp?topic=%2Fcom.ibm.help.domino.admin85.doc%2FH_STARTING_AND_STOPPING_THE_LDAP_SERVER_OVER.html).

trans-unit.source: To reload LDAP schema use Tell LDAP command - Tell LDAP ReloadSchema
trans-unit.target: To reload LDAP schema use Tell LDAP command - Tell LDAP ReloadSchema

trans-unit.source: Open Domino Admin and select People & Groups tab to see added attribute is reflected in domino Add Person (under Others tab)
trans-unit.target: Open Domino Admin and select People & Groups tab to see added attribute is reflected in domino Add Person (under Others tab)

trans-unit.source: Open Schema.nsf from **Files** tab and see added attribute is reflected under TestSubform LDAP Auxiliary object class.
trans-unit.target: Open Schema.nsf from **Files** tab and see added attribute is reflected under TestSubform LDAP Auxiliary object class.

trans-unit.source: Approach 3: Add the custom attribute to the ExtensibleObject class
trans-unit.target: Approach 3: Add the custom attribute to the ExtensibleObject class

trans-unit.source: Open [Schema.nsf] file placed on the root directory
trans-unit.target: Open [Schema.nsf] file placed on the root directory

trans-unit.source: Select LDAP Object Classes from the left menu under **All Schema Documents** and click on **Add Object class** button:
trans-unit.target: Select LDAP Object Classes from the left menu under **All Schema Documents** and click on **Add Object class** button:

trans-unit.source: Provide LDAP Name in the form of [###ExtensibleSchema] (where ### is the name of the default structural object class e.g. Person) with reference to the object for which you want to extend the schema.
trans-unit.target: Provide LDAP Name in the form of [###ExtensibleSchema] (where ### is the name of the default structural object class e.g. Person) with reference to the object for which you want to extend the schema.

trans-unit.source: For example, to extend the schema for Person object class, provide LDAP name [PersonExtensibleSchema].
trans-unit.target: For example, to extend the schema for Person object class, provide LDAP name [PersonExtensibleSchema].

trans-unit.source: Provide Superior Object class name, for which you want to extend the schema.
trans-unit.target: Provide Superior Object class name, for which you want to extend the schema.

trans-unit.source: For example, to extend the schema for Person object class, provide Superior Object class name [dominoPerson]:
trans-unit.target: For example, to extend the schema for Person object class, provide Superior Object class name [dominoPerson]:

trans-unit.source: Mention a valid OID corresponding to the object class.
trans-unit.target: Mention a valid OID corresponding to the object class.

trans-unit.source: Select Extended/custom attributes under Mandatory or Optional Attribute Types fields as per the requirement:
trans-unit.target: Select Extended/custom attributes under Mandatory or Optional Attribute Types fields as per the requirement:

trans-unit.source: After adding required attributes to the ExtensibleObjectClass, click on **Save & Close** button.
trans-unit.target: After adding required attributes to the ExtensibleObjectClass, click on **Save & Close** button.

trans-unit.source: An ExtensibleObjectClass will be created for respective default object class with extended attributes.
trans-unit.target: An ExtensibleObjectClass will be created for respective default object class with extended attributes.

trans-unit.source: Troubleshooting
trans-unit.target: Troubleshooting

trans-unit.source: For information on how to enable logging to troubleshoot the connector, see the [How to Enable ETW Tracing for Connectors](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=335731).
trans-unit.target: For information on how to enable logging to troubleshoot the connector, see the [How to Enable ETW Tracing for Connectors](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=335731).
